pr_title: Fixes Issue 2306: make Informers work with KubernetesServer CRUD mode

timeline.message:
Update CHANGELOG to reflect #2306 fix

Signed-off-by: Lalith Suresh <lsuresh@vmware.com>

timeline.bodyText: I think license check is failing due to this :-(
timeline.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText: Right now we have a fixed license header which includes Red Hat as the copyright owner. We faced similar issues when accepting contributions from an Oracle employee in #2030
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText: This is an unusual requirement. What's the fix?
replies.author: lalithsuresh

replies.bodyText: For now, Would it be possible for you to change owner to Red Hat? We do have plans to make license headers generic( #2045)
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText: Thanks. Would it be possible to just add this test case to an existing test class instead? Keeps things simple. :)
replies.author: lalithsuresh

replies.bodyText: We can do that, but I don't remember if we have any test class for testing informers in crud mode 🙄 . Do you think it's a good idea moving it here: https://github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client/blob/master/kubernetes-tests/src/test/java/io/fabric8/kubernetes/client/mock/DefaultSharedIndexInformerTest.java ?
replies.author: rohanKanojia

timeline.message:
Fixes #2306: Make KubernetesServer CRUD mode work with informers

This is addressed by making sure that MockWebServer returns a metadata object
for list queries.

Signed-off-by: Lalith Suresh <lsuresh@vmware.com>

Update CHANGELOG to reflect #2306 fix

Signed-off-by: Lalith Suresh <lsuresh@vmware.com>

Update CHANGELOG to reflect #2306 fix

Signed-off-by: Lalith Suresh <lsuresh@vmware.com>
